name: slay
content:
slay verb
(KILL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ T ] UK old use or literary to kill in a violent way: St George slew the dragon.
[ T ] mainly US (used especially in newspapers) to murder someone: He was found slain in an alley two blocks from his apartment.

slay verb
(IMPRESS)
[ I or T ] informal to impress someone very much or to be very good or impressive: The actors slay me with the quality of their acting. I came here to slay.

slay verb
(UPSET)
